textBox.richText: So I was getting ready to take a shower this morning and was going through random They Might Be Giants songs in my head when I stumbled upon “My Man” (a song about an unfortunate disabled man who can no longer walk due to problems with his nervous system). And then I realized: that could very well have been me. So many possible things could have easily have gone wrong. As previously stated, I could have become paralyzed; lost my ability to see correctly; or simply could have not survived the procedure. I really am so very lucky. The only consequence that really happened afterwards was that my eyes couldn’t focus all too well when trying to read. That, thankfully, remedied itself; but my eyes still don’t completely come to perfect focus when looking to the left––something I’ve never told anyone. That’s a minor issue though; I can still see perfectly nonetheless. Sometimes, I think this whole event was meant to happen or something. It has changed me, I know that. I grew up, in a sense. I now see things differently: things like love, my future, and just life in general. I don’t want opportunities to pass me by; if something is present in my life now, I want to act on it. I don’t want to let things escape from me. Life is short and you should make the most of it now with what you have. The world really is an amazing place. Take some time to look around and appreciate it for all it has.
